commitResults.messageTitle: Chatbot renamed to Mylo. Modified the greeting and goodbye messages.
Implemented echo-ing. Added static method separator() for ease of use.
Introduced TaskList and TaskModel with methods as per required for level 2. Improve the flow control in Mylo.java using switch-case.
Now able to mark and unmark the completion status of a task. Introduced methods such as getStatusIndicator, markTaskAsDone, markTaskAsUndone.

Implemented 3 task types: Todo, Deadline, Event. Uses factory method in Task class to decide which subtype to return. Modified the message printed. 
New Command: 1. todo ... 
2. event ... /from ... /to ... 
3. deadline ... /by ...
Implemented InsufficientInfoException and NoSuchCommandException. Errors such as invalid input and insufficient information are being handled.
Implemented delete command. delete <index> will delete the task at the index and prints deleted message if successful.

commitResults.messageBody:
Automated Text UI Testing is required to semi-automate the testing of Mylo.

input.txt when empty causes Mylo to throw exception since there is no next line.

Returning goodbye message is suitable when there is no next line.

Let's,
* modify Mylo.java to have input initiated to bye
* update EXPECTED.TXT to include goodbye message

Task list is temporary and lost after program terminates.

Automatic task save allows users to have their task list retained for next program execution.

Let's,
* create Storage class to handle the logic of save, rewrite and load local storage file
* create some exception classes to handle corrupted file format.

Date and time is stored as String.

LocalDateTime provides more meaningful methods such as to compare between two DateTime.

Let's,
* change the type for date to LocalDateTime
* add command to print deadlines/events on specific date
* add formatter and helper function in formatting date

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor the code to make it more OOP
commitResults.messageBody:
Code not closely adhere to OOP.

Code is not well organized without OOP.

Abstracting out closely related code as classes give a more organized code and is good for future increment.

Let's,
* abstract out closely related code into classes
* create Command, Parser, Ui, Storage and Task classes
* adhere to OOP in future increments

commitResults.messageTitle: Use gradle to automate some of the build tasks

commitResults.messageBody:
Methods in classes are not tested before commit.

JUnit helps test methods to detect any bugs when codes are modified.

Let's,
* merge build-gradle branch
* set up JUnit test for non trivial methods

Classes and methods do not have JavaDoc comments to explain their uses.

JavaDoc comments are required to provide code readibility and ease future code maintenance.

Let's add JavaDoc header comments to all non-private classes/methods.

User cannot search for tasks by keyword

It would be much more convenient if users are allowed to search using keyword.

Let's,
* introduce FindCommand class
* update Parser to identify find command
* implement tasksWithKeyword method

commitResults.messageTitle: Use checkstyle to detect coding style violations
